question: What do you think is the theme of the poem?
“Eyes that love you, arms that hold”. Who do eyes and arm refer to?
choice3: The people who are in love
choice4: The people who are in debt

question: Which line expresses the theme of the poem?
choice2: Give all you have been, or could be
choice3: Life has a loveliness to sell

question: Why do you think the line ‘Life has loveliness to sell’ has been repeated?
choice1: To reinforce the message that the poet wants to send out
choice2: To captivate the feelings of the readers
choice3: To make people more interested in love

question: Why are ‘thoughts’ described as ‘holy’?
choice1: Because they are pure thoughts, untained by any negativites
choice2: Because you don’t know about the peoples’ real thoughts
